net.dean.jraw.http

Class OkHttpAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.OkHttpAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpAdapter

    public final class OkHttpAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpAdapter
    Provides a concrete HttpAdapter implementation using Square's OkHttp

      • execute

        public RestResponse execute(HttpRequest request)
                     throws NetworkException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: HttpAdapter
        Executes an HTTP request.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface HttpAdapter
        Parameters:
        request - A model containing all necessary data
        Returns:
        A RestResponse from the resulting request
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful. A request is considered unsuccessful if the HTTP status code is less than 300 and greater than or equal to 200.
        java.io.IOException - If an implementation-specific error occurred.

      • setCookieManager

        public void setCookieManager(java.net.CookieManager manager)
        Description copied from interface: HttpAdapter
        Sets the CookieManager for the HTTP client to use. If the HTTP library does not support setting a CookieHandler but does use the Java default handler, then it is recommended to use CookieHandler.setDefault(CookieHandler) in addition.
        Specified by:
        setCookieManager in interface HttpAdapter

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(BasicAuthData authData)
        Description copied from interface: HttpAdapter
        Sets the username and password to use when a RestRequest is using HTTP Basic Authentication. These credentials should not be revoked until HttpAdapter.deauthenticate() is called.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface HttpAdapter

      • deauthenticate

        public void deauthenticate()
        Description copied from interface: HttpAdapter
        Revokes the current HTTP Basic Authentication credentials. HTTP Basic Authentication should not be used until HttpAdapter.authenticate(BasicAuthData) is called.
        Specified by:
        deauthenticate in interface HttpAdapter
